alert.note: Alert for Parke; Vermillion; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 11:51AM EST until January 15 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River at Montezuma. .Rainfall amounts of one to two inches across central Indiana Friday, combined with widespread rains of one to two inches earlier in the week, is bringing elevated river levels to the area. Minor lowland flooding is occurring on the Wabash River at Montezuma, which started late Saturday afternoon and is expected to last into Sunday night. River levels should crest close to flood stage in the Hutsonville and Riverton area. Flood warnings may be later needed for these locations. Flooding is not expected for the foreseeable future for forecast locations along the White and East Fork rivers and their tributaries. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Montezuma. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Several hundred acres of bottomlands along the right bank from the mouth of Sugar Creek to northern edge of Montezuma begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EST Sunday was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued around 300AM EST. late tonight by around 300 AM EST.
